intro: Pergularia clausa, commonly known as the closed pergularia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Pergularia clausa is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display.
